m:MaterialTitle.title: With Inertia
m:MaterialTitle.description: Inertia allows drag and resize actions to coninue after the user releases the pointer at a fast enough speed. The required launch speed, end speed and resistance can optionally be configured with the settings below

m:MaterialTitle.title: End Only
m:MaterialTitle.description: The endOnly option is used to restrict the widget around the corners of it's parent

m:MaterialTitle.title: Restriction
m:MaterialTitle.description: The restriction value specifies the area that the action will be confined to.

m:MaterialTitle.title: Self Restrict
m:MaterialTitle.description: With this option , It will only restrict the target on itself. By Default without this option will restrict to it's parent.

m:MaterialTitle.title: Specific Properties
m:MaterialTitle.description: For the left and right properties, 0 means the left edge of the element and 1 means the right edge. For top and bottom, 0 means the top edge of the element and 1 means the bottom.

m:MaterialLabel.text: On the example above, { top: 0.25, left: 0.25, bottom: 0.75, right: 0.75 } would result in a quarter of the element being allowed to hang over the restriction edges.

m:MaterialTitle.title: IgnoreFrom
m:MaterialTitle.description: You can ignore any widget inside the dnd target easily.

m:MaterialLink.text: This area is ignored from dragging

m:MaterialTitle.title: Axis
m:MaterialTitle.description: The axis in which the first movement must be in for the drag sequence to start. After the movement in that axis, the the action can move in both the HORIZONTAL and VERTICAL axes.
